website_summaries.verdict: This Japanese-made manual grinder produces coarse-ground beans for your French press just as well as finely ground espresso – a challenge with many competitors.
pros: Grinds from fine powder to French press
Easy, quick grind compared to other manual coffee grinders
cons: Handle does not directly attach and can come off relatively easily

customer_reviews.title: No warranty. It was nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: It's worked well until the porclin nut broke under normal use. Apparently the 7 year warranty doesn't apply when purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: OLD VERSION!! Beware the actual product that the seller sends to you!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the photo! The seller uses the photo for the new version of this grinder and then sends out the old version! I just returned mine. The old model was improved on because the handle would come off easily as you are grinding (pentagonal shaft). The new version has a new shaft design that keeps the handle on the shaft while grinding. It has the shape of a large minus sign or a Philips screwsdriver, rather than a tiny pentagon.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: broken product
customer_reviews.text: This seller sent broken product. I bought this one for our trip. When I opened grinder, I saw coffee inside and parts are broken already. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: No Cats No Life

customer_reviews.title: 2 years strong, so I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, my name is Alex, and I’m addicted to coffee. I used this little guy for the better part of two years. Definitely got my money’s worth and so I bought a second one to keep at work. In that time there were no chips in the burrs, the thing is still super simple to clean, the updated flat crankshaft bit totally solves the problems from the previous design, never rusted, never broke, and still gives a consistent grind. Also, it fits in your flashbang pouch. What else do you want?
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Received the old version first time
customer_reviews.text: Grinder seems well made, but I received the old version from seller 247ForYou. I returned and ordered again. The second time I received the new, updated version from seller SSSong.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: quality build but slow output
customer_reviews.text: Obviously well made.... this is built like a tank. It can generate a nice, even fine grind for espresso. My problem with it is quantity. It takes far too long to grind enough beans for a solid shot in my Aero-press, which is the only reason that I'd bought it. I will not be returning it, however. I could easily see bringing this with me camping. I debated between 3 and 4 stars. From a usability standpoint for my use case, this is a 3, but from a construction quality, quality of grind, and expected durability standpoint, this is a 5. Therefore, 4 stars it is.
customer_reviews.author: STS in New England

customer_reviews.title: I like the routine of grinding the beans
customer_reviews.text: For jeep trips when I need to have fresh ground coffee, this does the trick. I like the routine of grinding the beans: 110-120 turns of the grinder is part of the waking up process preceding good coffee! It does fit inside the Aeropress plunger but be aware that with temperature the bottom part can get stuck in the aeropress. If that happens, just warm up the aeropress and it will then slide out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

customer_reviews.title: Amazon NOT COVERED UNDER 7 YEAR WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: It was a great grinder until the inner burr broke. I contacted the manufacturer's distributor, Eight Ounce Coffee Supply in Canada. (the only US distributor) I was told they would not replace under the 7 year warranty because Amazon is NOT an authorized seller. I was going to purchase a $10 replacement part until I saw the least expensive shipping charge was $35! Oh well, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: make beer not bombs

customer_reviews.title: Eight years on and still works great. Near daily use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in 2012 while deployed in Afghanistan. With unreliable electricity I tried to use manual products where I could and still wanted to enjoy a good cup of coffee. Eight years later I am still using the same grinder I purchased and it works great. I should have written this review a long time ago but this should be a testament to the quality of this product eight years on and its' worldwide travel.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Grounds come out bad
customer_reviews.text: Overall not too happy with this grinder because of how poorly the grounds size distribution is. About 1/2 of the coffee comes out the correct grind size and the other half comes out as super fine dust. It is easy to use but that's about it. There are generic hand grinders similar to this on here for about $20 or less that seem to have the same burrs and grind similarly so don't waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little device
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy! I keep it in the fridge between uses so I only clean it every two weeks or so. High-quality ceramic parts. My favorite thing is that it works just as well for grinding espresso as for cold brew, and everything in between. I honestly bought this so I could take it to Europe with me, but it's seen daily use in our house. It's very cute and petite. I wouldn't recommend the mini for a big group of coffee drinkers, but it's been perfect for two people.
customer_reviews.author: k.bar

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: I used this 4x. I followed the directions to the letter regarding setup. It stopped working but I needed to continue to grind beans. I resorted to my electric grinder, in dismay.
customer_reviews.author: Nonna D

customer_reviews.title: Fast easy hand grinder than fits into an AeroPress
customer_reviews.text: Love the 'new' design. It's replacing a much loved, but worn porlex. This model has a much more secure connector between the handle and the grinder (so it doesn't fly off mid grind). It's smooth and quick to grind up a serving of coffee. Normally I only use if briefly on trips, but we've been using it as our only grinder for months now (we're on an extended trip hiding out during covid) and it's been easy and simple enough that we haven't bothered getting an electric grinder locally.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Liked it immediately
customer_reviews.text: Looks like very good quality and is easy to use. Does a very nice grind for a Moka Pot. Am drawing down my pre-ground stock in anticipation of going the "green" whole bean route. Even re-grinding pre-ground improves the taste significantly. TBD: Long term reliability ... I have no reason to believe this grinder will fail. In fact, I expect it to last quite well ... it just has that feel. However, it does have a ceramic part which IMO might be the most likely point of failure (probably due to a hard impact). On the other hand, it is very compact and is easy to handle/store so avoiding damaging it should not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling. No compromise
customer_reviews.text: Despite the super small size & compact design, it’s very easy to hold and grind the beans. Their patented handle design keeps it stay attached while grinding even some harder beans. Very well-thought design such as the rubber grip doubled as the handle holder, and great precision of the metal parts. The grounds are very consistent. It’s also great this fits in an AeroPress plunger. Saves the precious space in your carry-on or backpack. Now i regret why I didn’t look further and do more researches before buying a Hario mini slim plus grinder...
customer_reviews.author: Mineharu Takahara

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: We've ordered this grinder as a replacement for our "dedicated travel grinder" from a big company with three letters... The old one never worked as it should and broke before the end of warranty.. This one just does what it says. Keep it simple! Fill with beans, set the "Klicks" Turn the handle and you are served with finely ground, consistent quality coffee powder. We got the new version with the updated handle. The Ceramic burr is laser engraved and the overall quality is great. No cheap Chinese knockoff as claimed somewhere else. Would buy again, hope I don't have to soon...
customer_reviews.author: W. Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made Sand-Cast Hand Crank Makes This Quality Grinder Into Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is great for about 4 months of use. After this time, the cheaply made sand-cast hand-crank will wear out. After this point, it is impossible to turn the grinder, as shaft just slips. This is completely unacceptable for a product in this price-range and should never have made it through testing. Grinding during those initial four months was great, just not worth the 45$ price tag.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Only last for so long...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about it, except after using it for a bout an year [almost on daily basis] or so, the bottom part becomes very difficult to pull out. It's as if the opening got smaller or the friction between the middle/bottom parts became so high. I stop pushing the bottom part that collects the ground coffee all the way up now because it's physically impossible for me to pull it out anymore. It's usually stored when it's not being used, so I don't think it's because I did something to it that caused this. It just gradually got tighter the more I use this grinder...
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Simply fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for backpacking. It's a silly amount of weight to carry. But fresh ground coffee is an important ritual and ultra-lightweight standards be damned. The grind quality is excellent as it's a well made burr grinder. See  for an excellent accompaniment.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item, works well
customer_reviews.text: Received this little gem very quickly , nicely packaged. Easily assembled, perfect grind for my pour over coffee. Grinds quicker and easier than my previous handgrinder with more consistent grind. Easily packaged for travel, does not take much space . Initially I was a little worried about the price, but this is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Ines Len

customer_reviews.title: I don't do ultralight) but it's too useful at work
customer_reviews.text: wow. smaller than I expected, works as well as I'd hoped. Adjustability lets me grind for my reusable Keurig pods or set it for my press pot. I got it for camping (short hikes in, I don't do ultralight) but it's too useful at work. Gonna buy another one in a week or so. update: I did. My first one for camping use, is used daily here at the office. So I needed another to keep at home for "emergencies" or actual camping use. Been using this daily for 3 months now, no durability issues with the crank, the fitting at the top, or the rubber handle holder at all.
customer_reviews.author: Phugedaboudet

customer_reviews.title: Really like this grinder
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it takes a bit of time to grind 15g of beans; but for me it's not objectionable. Just chill out a bit and enjoy the grind! The good news is it's built well and seems like it will last a long time. UNLIKE the super-expensive Italian electric burr grinders at my office...ALL of which have broken down multiple times. Grind is consistent. Easily cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, portable, durable, highest quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these now, one for me and one for my wife, which we both use for travel. High quality and durable product. Size of grind can be adjusted. Easy to use (other than all the grinding!!). Cannot recommend highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: D. Squires

customer_reviews.title: New model received
customer_reviews.text: Mine was the new model with the slot top rather than the hex top. Appeared genuine as far as I could tell. Updated instructions are in Japanese as well as French and English. Worked great in my RV with my Aeropress when we were camping. Takes a few minutes to grind a whole batch but wasn't difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Caltechgirl

customer_reviews.title: Gave this as a gift and unfortunately the recipient couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift and unfortunately the recipient couldn't use it. The burrs for adjusting the grinder are misaligned. It is supposed to click when you turn the adjustment screw and it doesn't. By the time the recipient opened the gift, tried it and returned it us, the one month return window had run out. Contacted seller, who was unsympathetic and said that they can't do anything. But I'm not even considering that in my rating, just the fact that the item doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: vrpv

customer_reviews.title: This is a great grinder for coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder for coffee beans. I travel with this grinder as a part of my set with my aeropress coffee to have fresh coffee wherever I go. I don't like hotel coffee, or room service coffee. This hand grinder is burr type- is consistent in its ability to grind beans to your preference - and is COMPACT. It is faster than the other hand grinders (and I have had them all).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Terry Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, well constructed coffee mill
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my Hario Slim. We wore out two Hario's due to poor material and design. The Porlex is a nice coffee mill and a significant upgrade to the Hario. The body and mechanics are well made/designed. I would recommend this product, especially over the cheaper Hario.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This one works better. It seems to take less effort to grind ...
customer_reviews.text: I used a Kyocera ceramic coffee grinder (CM-45cf) for the last 7 years (almost daily). This one works better. It seems to take less effort to grind the beans. I ordered from SSSONG. The vendor answered questions promptly. The vendor said that this was the latest (non imitation) version. I uploaded pictures of the grinder and the box.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Best burl grinder
customer_reviews.text: Used many times... use it more than my automatic grinder. Can make a variety of adjustments to the grind. Fits into the aero press.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Zoidberg

customer_reviews.title: A great manual burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: Been using this 4x a week for the past month with our Aeropress. Really like it. The parts are all high quality and fit together well; I can totally taste the difference a burr grinder makes. Manual grinder is not a big deal; I don't mind at all when just making a cup for myself and/or my wife, in fact it's become part of the morning ritual... but if I had guests over I'd probably be having them grind their own damn cup >;-). It really does make a difference and I would not want to go back to chopper stile grinders.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Gould

customer_reviews.title: Stumptown-approved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping trips to use with my Aeropress. It works great and I love the grip on it. The grinder is very small, so it's perfect for small spaces. I was happy to see that Stumptown used it in their video outlining how to use an Aeropress.  Be aware that this grinder's packaging is entirely in Japanese. That said, I'm sure there are some English directions online somewhere. It takes me about 100 turns to grind 17 grams of beans (one scoop). The grinding is not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K

customer_reviews.title: The model that arrived is the old model with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The model that arrived is the old model with the pentagonal slot. Despite the picture starting that it's the updated one.
customer_reviews.author: Adrnsm

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near 20 gram capacity in specs
customer_reviews.text: This has probably 10 gram capacity maximum, which won't brew a full pour over coffee for one. It's not a lot of fun to get through one epic grind and realize you've got another 5 grams to go in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Lyla

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for travel and super cute
customer_reviews.text: This is so small and easy to pack, and I was getting a very even, fine grind. I used it for about 10 days so far -- I have a faster Zassenhaus to use at home -- and it seems like it will hold up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Van Gopher

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and pepper too! Handle Mod.
customer_reviews.text: As coffee addicts who need their home roasted beans when we're on the road, this is a great solution for carrying our freshly roasted beans with us. We found it so useful, we've gotten another for peppercorns. The beauty of this grinder for pepper is that the ground pepper ends up in the base and doesn't leave a circle of grains on the table. Great gift! Update: The handle easily falls off when grinding. See attached picture for an easy mod.
customer_reviews.author: RedPentacleB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grind very well
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for almost a year it works perfectly at the beginning but now isn't, I bought alternative brand from a local store. Please guide me through the return and refund process.
customer_reviews.author: Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: I'm very please with the Portex Mini Stainless Steal Coffee Grinder. It works as designed and is easier to use than expected. I have no trouble with grind size adjustments and change it often to accommodate the required grind size for French Press and Espresso. I hadn't wanted to spend nearly $50 for a small grinder but the quality makes it worth it. Cheers! =^..^=
customer_reviews.author: The Clean Veganista

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Manual Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: The Porlex coffee grinder has taken my at home coffee experience to a whole new level. I can now enjoy freshly ground coffee. The Porlex easily adjusts to various grinds so that I can use it for my drip coffee maker, my french press, or my Bee House pour over coffee maker. Due to its compact nature it stores easily in the cabinet and can be taken with me on camping trips. One of my best buys in a while!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder / questionable build
customer_reviews.text: Been using daily since purchase. Performs the function as described and has been reliable. Was a bit disappointed with the build quality as this is on the higher end of the cost spectrum. Feels slightly "thin" and I am guessing models that are half the cost would perform equally. Three stars due to the build vs cost not function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is great for grinding fresh coffee beans every morning while camping. Its not to heavy so its ideal for backpacking. Also its great for coffee when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: caleb thompson

customer_reviews.title: Using it daily 😁
customer_reviews.text: A little bit inconsistent grind but much better in comparison to any other beands. So far it is beet great
customer_reviews.author: ayako

customer_reviews.title: small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my husband as a travel grinder. He loves it. It grinds beautifully. So beautifully, in fact, that he ditched the electric blade coffee grinder completely, and now grinds with this exclusively. (He uses a Chemex at home and a Hario v60 while traveling.) We just discovered that our favorite indie coffee house now sells it as well, so it's got that extra little stamp of approval from our local baristas.
customer_reviews.author: GenuineImitation

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Batch Brewers
customer_reviews.text: Having used this grinder for a few months now, I'm happy to report that it performs exactly as advertised. I use this grinder almost exclusively for preparing French Press coffee (coarse ground), and enjoy it very much. Its high points include its compact size, the good quality flexible band for attaching the handle, and its ease of use for brewing a cup or two of coffee. The downsides include requiring multiple batches for more than a couple cups ("Hang on, company, just one more batch!"), and some irregularities in granule size at coarse grade grinding. I would never recommend this for espresso grinding, but it has greatly enriched my French Press experience. Thanks, Porlex!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lowry

customer_reviews.title: best coffee I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Grinder came promptly, grinds well at espresso and pourover type settings (these are trial and error settings). I love being able to get up and grind just what I need for my morning coffee without making enough noise to wake up my wife (not a coffee fan). since learning to use this grinder and learning to control bean:water ratio i have been making the best coffee I have ever made. There is a slightly larger version of this grinder that will easily hold about 27 - 30 grams of beans, but this mini grinder maxes out a about 22 grams. This is fine for me, but others might want to grind a little more in one go.
customer_reviews.author: steved

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, no batteries required.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my french press. All the directions are in japanese, so after a bit of trial and error i have dialed it in so that i get the same consistent grind every time. I only drink a few cups of coffee a week, but when I do, I like to do it right. Great for anywhere. Camping, road trips, at work, and you dont have to go to Starbucks, or worse, make the powder stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel or camping.
customer_reviews.text: This is small but very well built and is easy to use. I bought this for camping and it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Small but works great
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, much smaller that expected but works great for my french press. Must have in a travel trailer when you don't have electric hook up and nice size for storage. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Works great for traveling. The small size makes it easy to pack. The long handle actually makes it easier to turn than my full size grinder at home. I used it every day on a two week trip. I had to fill it once for each travel mug of coffee. It does take a little while to grind, but it is worth it to have fresh ground coffee. The quality seems very good, I expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the rubber clasp
customer_reviews.text: Grinds coffee. I don't like the rubber clasp, the metal tong on top appears slightly twisted, and the knob on the handle isn't alligned properly on mine, but everything else about this grinder was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: For the coffee addict that needs freshly ground this thing makes a very consistent grind. I bought it for camping but now use it at home where I have a nice electric burr grinder that I no longer use. It's a bit of a workout but it makes you appreciate your coffee that much more. The chamber seems to hold the perfect amount of coffee beans without having to weigh them. The burr grinder is ceramic so it won't rust when you clean it which I rarely do. Ceramic blades stay sharp forever. This is a well thought out high quality gizmo.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability.  Hard to keep handle on after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: This mill is very nice insofar as it efficiently provides a consistent grind and is highly adjustable. Unfortunately, after about 6 months of use the post onto which the handle slides has become worn and rounded off, causing the handle to constantly pop off during use. If the mill were redesigned to include a mechanism that secures the handle on while in use, I would consider purchasing again but with the current design.. not so much.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying very much.
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder is a joy to use! The build quality is top-notch. Everything fits tight and works great. I am using it to grind for an Aeropress and at larger grind settings, there does seem to be some inconsistency in the resulting bean size, but it hasn't been a problem. Very small, grinds easily and takes less time and effort than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Van Alstyne

customer_reviews.title: Compact and great value for money
customer_reviews.text: +Minimalistic design, small size (fits in a palm); +Has around 7 grind modes, which is perfect, as I drink both Turkish and filter coffee; - Takes more than a minute to grind 30g of beans (not an issue for me, but heard some complaints from other users)
customer_reviews.author: alla

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect grind and perfect amount for my French press. Quality products like this are hard to find. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: E. parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hard core coffee nerd and its impossible to start the day without some decent coffee. This is easy except when I'm on the road but now I've got a good alternative. In conjunction with the AeroPress this is a great travel coffee grinder and an amazing travel coffee kit. It takes the same 2 minutes to grind the beans as to warm a cup of water in the microwave and then you're in business.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Landvoigt

customer_reviews.title: Great for Luxury Backpacking Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great for taking backpacking, if you must have that gourmet experience! I like the size, portability, materials, construction and functionality but the grind is not consistent and is irregular, especially on coarser settings.
customer_reviews.author: VotesWithDollar

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: Smooth operation. Good consistent grind for my French Press. My first manual grinder. Grinds much easier than expected. About 90 seconds to grind 26 grams - about the max the hopper will hold. Bought this for travel but it is now my everyday grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits in Aeropress. Travels everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: I use this grinder daily for my morning coffee and love it. Consistent grind size, good speed, easy to use. It fits inside the Aeropress and has become part of my travel and camping kit. I had to purchase another one because the bolt started to strip and the handle fell into a lake while I was grinding and it fell off. As it was my fault, I still highly recommended this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: It is elegant and exactly the right size for a single cup of coffee. The only trick is getting a scoop of beans into the grinder without spilling them all over the place; I wrap my hand around the edge (essentially creating a funnel) and pour the beans in that way - my hand catches any beans that would have fallen. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lovely to use, and seems to be more efficient than my old Hario grinder.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little grinder
customer_reviews.text: The adjustment is a little off, the "clicks" to adjust are one or two clicks off. 4-5 'clicks' is for a Aeropress but it should be closer to 3-4, etc... It's perfect for camping and those Saturday mornings where you want to keep it quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: mine hand coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I'm the only coffee drinker in my house, and I'm a bit snobby about coffee too. my electric grinder is loud and annoys everyone else in the family. thus i purchased this! it's a little work but the grind is great. it serves my purpose and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Landry

customer_reviews.title: so I have it set very fine. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use for espresso, so I have it set very fine. Unfortunately, it is not consistent. My Hario does a much better job, but it's a bit too big for taking from place to place.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: light and easy to use. The Price is a little bit high but worth it. A very good choice for someone looking for a reliable manually grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small grinder
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built and easy to use -- a few tablespoons of beans in the top and in less than a minute, you've got evenly ground coffee. I've used it just about every day for a month, multiple times on weekends. It's awesome for small batches (2-4 cups), but takes a couple of loads to make a big pot of coffee. Setting the fineness of the grind is made easier by a clicking sound when you turn it. Starting at a fully tightened burr, 5-7 clicks and you're good to go for a pretty versatile grind.
customer_reviews.author: mamichae

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for any coffee afficionado!
customer_reviews.text: Magnificent. Unbelievable. NOT words I would have ever thought to use for a coffee grinder! But it is extraordinary...gives a consistent, uniform grind, even to the perfect fine-ness for espresso. Awesome for travel and the office. Well, and...so much fun to use that we even like to use it at home despite our top-of-the-line Mazzer grinder blades! Compact, easy to use and to pack, due to it's long, but removable grinding arm.
customer_reviews.author: FL flamingo

customer_reviews.title: No need for anything else
customer_reviews.text: They got it right. I purchased my first Porlex in Osaka, Japan years ago. It's so quick, effective and easy to use that by comparison, electric coffee grinders seem like a hugely over-engineered concept, unless you run a coffee shop.
customer_reviews.author: mutsureibo

customer_reviews.title: Size up.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but should have gotten the bigger size. I got it so that I could have a portable coffee station with my aeropress. It does fit in the plunger, but then you have the loose handle. So I don't store it in the plunger. If I want to make a big cup of coffee it takes too long for me to grind the beans. Get the size up.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED HANDLE CONTACT. Thank you for this!!! No more handle flying off when I’m grinding from wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Hjoyowen

customer_reviews.title: Works great.

However there are two things that I don't get used to, the first one is the black ribbon doesn't offers you the grip you need, the second one is more about the size of the grinded coffee, in my opinion is quite irregular.

customer_reviews.text: I liked it a lot until it cracked. The mouth cracked in three places, probably the result of some lateral pressure, but I don't know how. customer_reviews.title: Adjust Coarseness of the Grind?
customer_reviews.text: This grinder grinds the coffee as fine as gunpowder. That may be fine for espresso coffee. But I want a coarser grind for my French press coffee maker. There are several grinds . . . fine through coarse . . . on the box. But ALL the instructions are in Japanese. Does anyone know how to adjust the coarseness of the grind? Thanks. for the link to instructions to adjust the texture of the ground coffee. It is as easy at that.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little grinder!!! Tip for grinding faster.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing compact grinder and a perfect companion to the AeroPress. After using the Porlex for several weeks, by pure coincidence, I figured out a better/faster to grind. Instead holding down on a flat surface with one hand, and turning the lever with the other, I hold it in mid-air turning both hands at the same time. Sort of a bicycle pedaling motion on on the horizontal plane. Very effective.

customer_reviews.text: This grinder is perfect for my application, which is grinding beans for my Keurig brewer reusable cup. grind is even, and use is easy.

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder - watch the handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful grinder. I own two of them. Small, easy to use, tough, pretty consistent grind. It is perfect for travel and a great companion to a small French Press. The grinder is nicely adjustable and comes apart easily for cleaning. The only problem, as others have stated, is that the crank handle will often slip off of the shaft. You can develop a technique where you tilt your wrist to create downward pressure on the shaft end of the handle but the handle will still slip off pretty regularly.
